metadata.title: CVE-2021-47152 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:fix data stream corruption Maxim reported several issues when forcing a TCPtransparent proxy to use the MPTCP protocol for the inbound connections. Healso provided a clean reproducer. The problem boils down to'mptcp_frag_can_collapse_to()' assuming that only MPTCP will use the givenpage_frag. If others - e.g. the plain TCP protocol - allocate pagefragments, we can end-up re-using already allocated memory formptcp_data_frag. Fix the issue ensuring that the to-be-expanded datafragment is located at the current page frag end. v1 -> v2: - added missingfixes tag (Mat)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47152` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-20.20
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-20.20
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1003-laptop - 6.5.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1002-starfive - 6.5.0-1002.3
No subscription required
